form.official-title: To amend the State Department Basic Authorities Act of 1956 to provide for an exemption of reimbursement for certain travel to return to the United States, and for other purposes.

section.header: Exemption of reimbursement for certain travel to return to the United States
section.text: Section 4 of the State Department Basic Authorities Act of 1956 (22 U.S.C. 2671) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: In the case of loans made after October 6, 2023, for purposes of evacuations from Israel in response to the Hamas terrorist attacks of October 2023, the reimbursement requirements under subsections (b)(2)(A)(ii) and (d) shall not apply.

The Comptroller General of the United States shall submit to Congress a report on any commercial airfare price manipulation and instances of price gouging by airlines relating to the evacuation of United States citizens from Israel after the Hamas attacks in October 2023.
The report required by subsection (a) shall include the following:

paragraph.text: A comparison of airfare ticket prices before the attacks and after the attacks, disaggregated byâ€”

subparagraph.text: flights originating in Israel, Turkey, Jordan, Egypt, Lebanon, and Greece; and
airports designated as primary evacuation destinations by the Department of State.

paragraph.text: A proposal to provide for a voluntary survey opportunity for individuals described in subsection (a) to submit information regarding instances of such price manipulation.
An analysis of whether any actions regarding price manipulation or other changes violated United States law.
